location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘6. Sketch Map of the Country Between Umm Al Hanna and Kut-Al-Amara Showing the Attack from the South on the Dujaila Redoubt. Compiled from the War Diary of Columns A and B Commanded by Major General G.V. Kemball, C.B., D.S.O., from 7th to 9th March 1916’

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:225 x 320 mm, on sheet 380 x 405 mm

mods.abstract: Imprint:Vandyked at the Survey of India Offices, Dehra Dun. S.D.O. 3935.3-25.Distinctive Features:Relief shown by hachures.Map showing the area between Umm Al Hanna and Kut-Al-Amara [Al-Kūt] produced to illustrate the movements of the British and the Turkish military forces between 7th and 9th March 1916. Shows the positions of various divisions with number of troops and guns reported.Contains key to symbols and a note at the bottom margin below scale statement: ‘This sketch is a reproduction of T.C.4 the only map then available. Having been compiled from aeroplane sketches it is not accurate’.Map overprinted with numeric reference grid.
